p: Except for the first period, attributable mortality remains practically the same as in the reference period 2009–2013, i.e. 67 (19–117), as seen in Table 4. The number of hot days per year is always the same, since the threshold temperature is based on a percentile. These results are in line with a heat-acclimatization process, the fact that there is no variation in attributable risk, and that variations are solely due to temperature, since mortality has also been kept constant in each year.
